text: Although evidence from the field clearly indicates the ability of H9N2 viruses to induce pathology at the level of the oviduct [ 17 ] , only few studies have investigated the tropism of these agents for this organ , in a controlled experimental setting [ 18 ] [ 19 ] [ 20 ] [ 21 ] . Wang et al . proved in fact , that a H9N2 virus of the Y280 lineage isolated in the Shangxii province in 2011 , could replicate at high titers in the oviduct , trigger apoptosis and cause a decrease in the number of laid eggs in the first week post infection and a reduction in egg - shell thickness [ 18 , 20 ] .
